meanings.definition: Making or showing an unjust or prejudicial distinction in treatment.
meanings.sent1: The discriminatory policy favored some employees over others.
meanings.sent2: She felt hurt by the discriminatory comments made about her appearance.
meanings.sent3: It's discriminatory to only let the tallest students play basketball.
meanings.sent4: The discriminatory hiring practices left many qualified candidates without jobs.
meanings.sent5: The discriminatory behavior of the teacher was quickly reported to the principal.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or showing prejudicial treatment.
meanings.sent1: The discriminatory actions of the company led to a lawsuit.
meanings.sent2: He faced discriminatory behavior based on his religious beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The discriminatory pricing made it impossible for some customers to afford the product.
meanings.sent4: The discriminatory attitude of the supervisor created a toxic work environment.
meanings.sent5: The discriminatory nature of the law was challenged in court.
